page.title: 05CHIPPENHAM RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Chippenham Station is on the main railway line between London and Bristol.This was part of the {Great {Western Railway}built by{Isambard {Brunel}from 1856-58,which was to link the port of Bristol and South Wales to London. The original station building and Brunel's office still stand today,they were built in 1841 with local stone from the excavations of{Box Tunnel}to the West of Chippenham. Chippenham is on the line from London, (Paddington) to Bristol,(Temple Meads). It is operated by{Inter City {125 High Speed Trains.}The journey time from London to Chippenham is just one hour. Next to the station is{Westinghouse {Brake and Signal Company}which designs and makes electrical and electronic products.
